title: Custom Property, object flattened and pushed into attributes (not props)
body:
I have a small mixin that creates a propType as follows:

```
var OtherDataMixin = {
    propTypes: {
      otherData: React.PropTypes.object
    },
    getInitialState: function () {
      this.otherData=getAll();
      return this.otherData;
    },
};
return OtherDataMixin;
```

where the getAll() function returns an Object like this

```
{variables: Object, theme: Object, functions: Object, wanted: Object, AppShell: Object }
```

Effectively passing back a custom collection of objects with various values that are being used.

The property this.otherData holds this information and you can reference it from components using a standard dot notation, so this.otherData.variables.timeout gets a value;

The issue is that for some reason this is all getting flattened into this.attributes
so this.attributes now has these objects

```
attributes: Object
    AppShell: Object 
    className: 'app-shell',
    functions: Object,
    theme: Object,
    variables: Object,
    wanted: Object,
    __proto__: Object
```

but there is no sign of the otherData object at all...
I could logically have understooed if it adding the custom property to this.props, which would then be

```
props: Object
    children: Array[2]
    otherData: object
```

Go I guess my questions are two fold:
- Why has it put this into this.attributes in the first place and not this.props?
- Why did it flattened the hierarchy, instead of just adding otherData as an object ?
